question.title: Limiting the number of requests per minute to grpc API
question.body:
To interact with grpc API I use java-client generated from proto-files.

The used grpc API has some limit on the number of requests per minute. I would like to proactively wait for the end of the minute if the allowed number of requests has been made. I would like to avoid exceeding the allowed requests if possible and implement the corresponding logic based on a negative response from the server.

How can this be done more elegantly? Perhaps there is some corresponding decorator for io.grpc.Channel?
